api Package¶

api Package¶

Quickly expose your models to a JSON or XML API, authenticated via HTTP or OAuth.

bambu.api.autodiscover()[source]¶

Works like django.contrib.admin.autodiscover, running thorugh each of the packages within a project’s INSTALLED_APPS setting, to find instances of an api module which might contain calls to bambu.api.site.register.

Unlike django.contrib.admin.autodiscover, you do not need to call this function manually.

endpoints Module¶

Exposes API endpoints for the django.contrib.auth.models.User and django.contrib.auth.models.Group models.

helpers Module¶

bambu.api.helpers.form_initial_data(form_class, obj=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates a dictionary of data to be passed as ‘initial data’ to a form.

bambu.api.helpers.generate_random_key(length=32)[source]¶

Generates a random password for a user. This is purely for display purposes, from within the project’s developers’ section.

bambu.api.helpers.get_request_logger()[source]¶
bambu.api.helpers.send_oauth_error(err)[source]¶

Send an OAuth error to the HTTP client.

bambu.api.helpers.trim_indent(docstring)[source]¶

Helps in formatting document strings for display within the project’s developers’ section.

bambu.api.helpers.wrap_api_function(site, view, detail_level, allowed_methods, processor)[source]¶

A decorator which wraps certain functions, so that a number of checks can be run before the function is called (ie: checking that the HTTP method is allowed).

bambu.api.helpers.wrap_api_page(site, view, allowed_methods)[source]¶

A decorator which wraps certain functions, so that a number of checks can be run before the function is called (ie: checking that the HTTP method is allowed).

managers Module¶

class bambu.api.managers.TokenManager[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.manager.Manager

Manager for the bambu.api.models.Task model.

create_token(app, token_type, timestamp, user=None)[source]¶

Create an OAuth token of a given time.

::param app: The app to bind the token to ::type app: bambu.api.models.App

::param token_type: The type of token to create, either 1 for a request token or 2 for an access token ::type token_type: integer

::param timestamp: The UNIX timestamp for the token ::type timestamp: integer

::param user: The user to attach the token to ::type user: django.contrib.auth.models.User

::default user: None
